title: How to Enable Gmail Desktop Notifications

steps.title: Go to https://www.gmail.com in your computer's web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.gmail.com in your computer's web browser. This will open your Gmail inbox if you're logged in. If you aren't logged into Gmail, enter your email address and password when prompted.

steps.title: Click the gear icon at the top-right corner, and then select More Settings.
steps.content: Click the gear icon at the top-right corner, and then select More Settings . When you click the gear, you'll open your Quick Settings on the right panel. On that panel, select "More Settings" to view all of your Gmail settings.

steps.title: This section is toward bottom of the General tab.
steps.content: This section is toward bottom of the General tab.

steps.title: You can receive notifications for all messages, or just those you deem important.
steps.content: You can receive notifications for all messages, or just those you deem important. Check the box next to the option that describes the notifications you want to receive. New mail notifications on: Displays a notification every time you receive a new message. Important mail notifications on: If a message is flagged as "Important," you'll see a notification. If you want to hear a sound along with the notification pop-up, choose an option from the "Mail notification sounds" drop-down menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Save Changes.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Save Changes . It's at the bottom of the page. Now that you've enabled notifications, you'll see web browser pop-ups each time you receive a new email message. Your web browser must be open to receive Gmail desktop notifications.
